params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.config_bucket
params.description: Optional. A Google Cloud Storage staging bucket used for sharing generated SSH keys and config. If you do not specify a staging bucket, Cloud Dataproc will determine an appropriate Cloud Storage location (US, ASIA, or EU) for your cluster's staging bucket according to the Google Compute Engine zone where your cluster is deployed, and then it will create and manage this project-level, per-location bucket for you.

params.name: data.gce_cluster_config
params.description: Required. The shared Google Compute Engine config settings for all instances in a cluster.

params.name: data.master_config
params.description: Optional. The Google Compute Engine config settings for the master instance in a cluster.

params.name: data.worker_config
params.description: Optional. The Google Compute Engine config settings for worker instances in a cluster.

params.name: data.secondary_worker_config
params.description: Optional. The Google Compute Engine config settings for additional worker instances in a cluster.

params.name: data.software_config
params.description: Optional. The config settings for software inside the cluster.

params.name: data.initialization_actions
params.description: Optional. Commands to execute on each node after config is completed. By default, executables are run on master and all worker nodes. You can test a node's role metadata to run an executable on a master or worker node, as shown below using curl (you can also use wget): ROLE=$(curl -H Metadata-Flavor:Google http://metadata/computeMetadata/v1/instance/attributes/dataproc-role) if [[ "${ROLE}" == 'Master' ]]; then ... master specific actions ... else ... worker specific actions ... fi

methods.name: getConfigBucket
methods.description:
Optional. A Google Cloud Storage staging bucket used for sharing generated SSH keys and config. If you do not specify a staging bucket, Cloud Dataproc will determine an appropriate Cloud Storage location (US, ASIA, or EU) for your cluster's staging bucket according to the Google Compute Engine zone where your cluster is deployed, and then it will create and manage this project-level, per-location bucket for you.

methods.name: getInitializationActions
methods.description:
Optional. Commands to execute on each node after config is completed. By default, executables are run on master and all worker nodes.

You can test a node's role metadata to run an executable on a master or worker node, as shown below using curl (you can also use wget): ROLE=$(curl -H Metadata-Flavor:Google http://metadata/computeMetadata/v1/instance/attributes/dataproc-role) if [[ "${ROLE}" == 'Master' ]]; then ... master specific actions ... else ... worker specific actions ... fi

Generated from protobuf field repeated .google.cloud.dataproc.v1.NodeInitializationAction initialization_actions = 11;
